intro: Abies spectabilis subsp. langtangensis, commonly known as the Langtang fir, is a rare subspecies native to the Himalayas, particularly in Nepal and Tibet. It is a coniferous evergreen tree that typically grows in high-altitude regions, reaching heights of up to 30 meters. The tree has slender, cylindrical cones and dark green, needle-like leaves that are arranged in spirals along the branches. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, often developing fissures with age. This subspecies is adapted to cold, moist environments and plays a significant ecological role in its alpine habitat.

The plant thrives in cool, moist climates with well-drained soils. It is an important component of the temperate forests in this region.
